Why a job closer to your home is better than one that pays you more but needs relocation or hectic travel everyday. While we all have preferred jobs that offer us great careers along with excellent remuneration but also requiring us to relocate or commute longer. 
Covid time has taught us all a lot and it may be time to re-evaluate some of this as well. Ofcourse this is not the right time to change your job but if you are impacted due to business changes then do keep this in mind. It doesn't matter in the long run if you made 20% more for a role in Bangalore though you are a Delhite--u take your cost of living given the benefits of being at home with your family. Having done this a few times myself--the cost benefit analysis tells you something else when you add all the additional costs of travel and losing out on family moments. So rethink and don't let monetary aspect be the major decision maker. Also if you know your business will get impacted in the next couple of months make a decision now basis this than wait for that grand opportunity that pays you more in a different city.  Another important aspect is re-adjust your expectations at this time from a hike perspective--what worked pre-Covid times has changed a lot. 
Hope we can all make some great decisions.
